member.name: T:GridWorld.TanksVision
member.summary: Contains the code needed to determine whether a tank with a particular facing in one GridSquare can see another GridSquare, and to determine the GridSquares that can be seen by a Tank with a particular facing looking from a particular square. A very conservative approach to vision is taken, where a (virtual) straight line is drawn from the centre of the square that we are looking from (xf,yf) to the square we are looking to (xt,yt). If this virtual line passes through any square (even touches the corner of a given square) then (xt,yt) cannot be seen.

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.#ctor(GridWorld.GridSquare[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an object for tanks vision.

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.TestVisionCone
member.summary: Generate a lot of output which demonstrates what can be seen from each square in the Grid with each Facing. For test purposes only.

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.IsBlocked(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Does (x,y) block vision? A null GridSquare always blocks vision.

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.GetVisibleSquares(GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Facing,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get all of the squares which are visible from (xf,yf) with Facing dir. This is currently somewhat inefficient as it works out for every GridSquare in the vision cone whether it can be seen or not.

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.CanSee(GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Facing,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: From (xf,yf) with facing dir can I see (xt,yt)?

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.CanSee_xb_le_yb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks each intermediate square between from (xf,yf) to (xt,yt) to see if any are blocked. Requires that |yt-yf|>=|xt-xf| since each time I increment y it needs to check the squares above and below where the intersection line from (xf,yf) to (xt,yt) crosses a square boundary. (if we do not have |yt-yf|>=|xt-xf| then this approach misses some squares).

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.CanSee_yb_le_xb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks each intermediate square between from (xf,yf) to (xt,yt) to see if any are blocked. Requires that |xt-xf|>=|yt-yf| since each time I increment x it needs to check the squares above and below where the intersection line from (xf,yf) to (xt,yt) crosses a square boundary. (if we do not have |xt-xf|>=|yt-yf| then this approach misses some squares).

member.name: M:GridWorld.TanksVision.VisibleSquareToString(GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Facing,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{GridWorld.GridSquare})
member.summary: Return in string format the GridSquares that can be seen from (xf,yf) by a tank with Facing dir. Assumes that the GridSquares have already been found and are in vissq. The facing of the tank is denoted by "^", ">", "v" etc. "+" denotes an empty square that is visible, "*" denotes a blocked square that is visible, "." denotes an empty square that is not visible, "#" denotes a blocked square that is not visible.

member.name: T:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState
member.summary: PlayerWorldState contains all of the data available to the player at the start of each turn. In a game of incomplete information (e.g. Terrarium) this will be only part of the world state. Both PlayerWorldState and WorldState are derived from BaseWorldState which contains common functionality.

member.name: F:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.newStateInformationThisTurn
member.summary: Is there new information on the number of shots, kills, or squares seen this turn?

member.name: F:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.hasWorldStateChangeForThisTurn
member.summary: Is there a WordStateChange for this turn whose NewContents/NewPlayer is this tanks/player?

member.name: F:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.MoveDestinationFinalised
member.summary: Has this player's Tank's move destination been finally determined? Used when actioning all moves in WorldState.

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.GetFacing(GridWorld.GridSquare.ContentType)
member.summary: Convert a GridSquare.ContentType to a Facing if it is one of TankUp, TankDown, TankLeft, TankRight, otherwise throw an exception.

member.name: F:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.myFacing
member.summary: Your tank's facing.

member.name: F:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.grid
member.summary: The current grid - actually just a local pointer to the WorldState grid.

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.IsVisible(GridWorld.GridSquare)
member.summary: Returns whether the current square can be seen by the player (purely for the purposes of the ToString() function of the baseplayer class)

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.IsTank(GridWorld.GridSquare)
member.summary: Returns if the GridSquare given contains a tank

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.ToString
member.summary: Output the Tanks board in a readable text format. . = empty square, # = Rock, D = Destroyed Tank, space = NotVisible, ^,v,>, = tank with facing (including your own tank). The world is enclosed by a border.

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.CanSee(GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Facing,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,GridWorld.GridSquare[0:,0:])
member.summary: From (xfrom,yfrom) with facing dir can I see (xto,yto)?

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.GetTooltipText
member.summary: Return the text displayed at the bottom of any tooltip for one of this players tanks.

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.GetSymbol(GridWorld.GridSquare.ContentType)
member.summary: Return the output symbol for this GridSquare

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.VisibleSquaresToString
member.summary: Return in string format the GridSquares that can be seen by your tank. The facing of each tank is denoted by "^", ">", "v" etc. "." denotes an empty square, "^", ">","v" etc. denotes an enemy tank and its facing, "#" denotes a rock, "D" denotes a destroyed tank.

member.name: F:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Tanks
member.summary: The Tanks for this player.

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.AddTank(GridWorld.GridSquare)
member.summary: Add a new Tank

member.name: M:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.RemoveAllTanks
member.summary: Remove all Tanks (player's Tank has been destroyed).

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.EmptySquaresSeen
member.summary: The number of empty squares seen so far by your tank, including squares occupied by your tank, where you have seen an opposing or destroyed tank, and squares occupied by enemy tanks which you detected firing.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.RockSquaresSeen
member.summary: The number of rock squares seen so far by your tank.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.ShotsFired
member.summary: The number of shots fired by your tank so far.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Kills
member.summary: The number of tanks destroyed by your tank so far. If you and another player both destroy the same tank on a given turn, then both are credited with a kill.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Score
member.summary: Your tank's score.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.MaximumVisionDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance, in squares, that your tank can see.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.MyGridSquare
member.summary: The GridSquare containing your tank.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.ScorePerEmptySquareSeen
member.summary: The score obtained for viewing an Empty GridSquare for the first time (including squares occupied by your tank, where you have seen an opposing or destroyed tank, and squares occupied by enemy tanks which you detected firing).

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.ScorePerRockSquareSeen
member.summary: The score available for viewing a Rock GridSquare.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.ScorePerOpposingTankDestroyed
member.summary: The score for destroying an opponent's Tank.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.MyFacing
member.summary: The direction in which your Tank is pointing, Up, Down, Left or Right.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.PlayerCount
member.summary: The maximum number of players who normally play in this terrain. If players have been eliminated this will be greater than the number actually playing.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.GridHeightInSquares
member.summary: The height of the grid in squares.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.GridWidthInSquares
member.summary: The width of the grid in squares.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.TurnNumber
member.summary: The current turn number. For a game playing/replaying this always reflects the turn currently just about to be played/replayed.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.ID
member.summary: The ID number of this player (Player 1 has ID = 1, PLayer 2 has ID = 2 etc).

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.MyVisibleSquares
member.summary: A List of the GridSquares visible from your Tank's current position and facing. You have a 90-degree cone of vision (45 degrees either side of the direction you are pointing), where rock, tanks and destroyed tanks hide squares behind them, and a limited vision range MaximumVisionDistance which can vary from terrain to terrain.

member.name: P:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Access grid square (x,y).

member.name: T:GridWorld.PlayerWorldState.Facing
member.summary: The directions in which the Tank's turret can point.

member.name: T:GridWorld.Command
member.summary: A command contains the data for a single instruction from a player (interactive or AI). The only command in Infectious! is to move an active colony from (XFrom, YFrom) to (XTo, YTo)

member.name: M:GridWorld.Command.#ctor(GridWorld.Command.Move,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Command your tank to Stay, Up, Down, Left, Right, RotateLeft or RotateRight and tell it whether or not to shoot.

member.name: M:GridWorld.Command.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this Command.

member.name: P:GridWorld.Command.CommandMove
member.summary: The Move part of this Command, one of Stay, Up, Down, Left, Right, RotateLeft or RotateRight.

member.name: P:GridWorld.Command.CommandShoot
member.summary: The Shoot part of this command. If true a shot will be fired after moving.

member.name: T:GridWorld.Command.Move
member.summary: The possible ways that a tank may move: Stay, Up, Down, Left, Right, RotateLeft or RotateRight.

member.name: T:GridWorld.WorldState
member.summary: WorldState contains complete information about the state of the game world. In a game of incomplete information, the data herein is a superset of the data in each PlayerWorldState. Even in a game of complete information, the presentation of the data in WorldState (used for game rules management) and of the data in PlayerWorldState (used for AI) may be different. Both PlayerWorldState and WorldState are derived from BaseWorldState which contains common functionality.

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.grid
member.summary: The current grid.

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.gameOverText
member.summary: null string until game end.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.isValidPickupPiece(GridWorld.GridSquare,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks to see if the contents of the GridSquare can be picked up by a user.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.IsLegal(System.Int32,GridWorld.Command)
member.summary: Checks whether command c moves player p to a square without a fixed obstacle, within the grid.
member.param: The ID of the player issuing the command, 1,2,3,...
The command to be tested for legality

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.GetToolTipTextForGridSquare(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the tooltip text for grid square (x,y). Throws an exception if (x,y) out of range.

member.summary: Get the player number for grid square (x,y). Throws an exception if (x,y) out of range.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ToString
member.summary: Output the Infectious! board in a readable text format (for at most 10 players). . = empty square, # = impassable square, 1 = player 1 active colony, [Shift][1] = ! = player 1 passive colony, 2 = player 2 active colony, [Shift][2] = " = player 2 passive colony, 3 = player 3 active colony, [Shift][3] = Â£ = player 3 passive colony, ... 9 = player 9 active colony, [Shift][9] = ( = player 9 passive colony, 0 = player 10 active colony, [Shift][0] = ) = player 10 passive colony.

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.turnCommandsAvailable
member.summary: Does the current interactive (or AI) player have some commands for the current turn entered by the user?

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.theInteractivePlayerCommand
member.summary: A list of commands for an InteractivePlayer.

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.worldStateChanges
member.summary: An arrayList containing all WorldStateChanges. Note WorldStateChanges associated with turn 0 are terrain instructions.

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.turnIndexes
member.summary: Pointers to the first element of each turn in the worldStateChanges array.

member.name: F:GridWorld.WorldState.gameFinished

member.summary: The name of the terrain that the current game started on.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.#ctor
member.summary: Create a "blank" WorldState that must then be "filled in" by a call to Initialise()

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.InitialiseTerrain(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a worldstate for the players passed to it and game information contained in the wscs WorldStateChange array. Only actions changes to the grid for turn 0.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.UpdateStateInformationInTheGridAndThisTurnsWorldStateChanges
member.summary: Update the newstate for any WorldStateChange where the NewContents is a tank that has seen new squares

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ActionCommand(System.Int32,GridWorld.ICommand)
member.summary: Attempt to modify the WorldState according to command c from player p. Return true if successful and false otherwise. Does not test for ambiguity of the command. Also checks for game end.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ActionAllCommands
member.summary: Performs all the actions necessary to run the game

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ActionAndFinaliseMoveDestinationForAllMovesToEmptySquares
member.summary: Do all possible moves to place Tanks on empty squares. Return true if at least one move succeeded. (i.e. a new empty square was created).

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ActionTankMove(System.Int32)
member.summary: When you call this function the myCommand for this player has been confirmed as legal. Update the Grid and add the WorldStateChanges for this move.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.SetXToAndYToForAllTanksAndChangeIllegalMovesToStay
member.summary: Set the destination square (xto,yto) for each tank (and if the destination square would be off the board or to a fixed obstacle (destroyed tank or rock) change the command to "Stay" and do not change the shooting decision.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.UpdateVisibleSquaresAndWorldStateScores
member.summary: Scores the players for new squares seen and update player lists of visible squares

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ChangeCrossoverMovesToStay
member.summary: This changes any player's moves which would involve "crossing over" (tank at (p1,p2) tries to move to (q1,q2), and tank at (q1,q2) tries to move to (p1,p2)) OR (tanks at (p1,p2) and (q1,q2) both try to move to the same square)

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.RemoveMovesWhereTanksMoveToSameSquare
member.summary: If two player tanks move to the same square, change both to "Stay" (Should shoot be disabled??) ++: both may die if both shoot --: one may lose out if only one shooting Compromise?: if both are going to shoot, cancel both, else let the one shooter fire.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ChangeIllegalMovesToStay
member.summary: This changes any illegal move to "Stay", maintaining their "shoot" command.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.DoTankShooting
member.summary: Fires the player's turret at it's current facing

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.RemoveDeadTanks
member.summary: Removes the tanks that were destroyed this turn from play.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.PassMove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enter a pass move.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.GetNewStateKills(GridWorld.WorldStateChange)
member.summary: extract the number of kills from the NewState string of wsc which is in the format ShotsFired,Kills,OreSquaresSeen,RockSquaresSeen

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.GetNewStateShots(GridWorld.WorldStateChange)
member.summary: extract the number of ShotsFired from the NewState string of wsc which is in the format ShotsFired,Kills,OreSquaresSeen,RockSquaresSeen

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.GetNewStateOreSquaresSeen(GridWorld.WorldStateChange)
member.summary: extract the number of OreSquaresSeen from the NewState string of wsc which is in the format ShotsFired,Kills,OreSquaresSeen,RockSquaresSeen

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.GetNewStateRockSquaresSeen(GridWorld.WorldStateChange)
member.summary: extract the number of RockSquaresSeen from the NewState string of wsc which is in the format ShotsFired,Kills,OreSquaresSeen,RockSquaresSeen

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ActionWorldStateChange(GridWorld.WorldStateChange)
member.summary: The only way to change the grid. Action a given WorldStateChange and update variables for active colonies and scores.

member.summary: Is ct a living tank in one of the four directions?

member.summary: Go to the end of the replay file, changing the grid.

member.summary: The only function allowed to change the world state (apart from UndoLastWorldStateChange below).
member.param: Should the 2D grid array be changed or not (i.e do I actually execute this turn)?

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.UndoLastWorldStateChange
member.summary: Undo the last world state change and restore the grid. Returns the world state change corresponding to what was done i.e. the reverse of the WorldStateChange removed

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.GetGridSquareChangesForCurrentlyNonEmptySquares
member.summary: Get the current state of the board in terrain form by 1. Making all WorldState changes have a turn number of zero 2. Only considering the last WorldStateChange for each GridSquare, and ignoring that if the transition is to being empty
member.returns: Arraylist of WorldStateChanges for currently non-empty grid squares

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.ChangeToTerrain
member.summary: Changes the current WorldState (as at the current WorldState.TurnNumber) to a terrain file

member.summary: Grid square changes can *only* be actioned by calling this function, which updates the global worldStateChanges arrays as well as PlayerWorldState worldStateChanges.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.CheckForGameEnd
member.summary: The game is finished when no player can make another legal move. This function can be made much more efficient by maintaining local data structures for whether a player can move and where active colonies are.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.UndoLastTurnWithWorldStateChanges
member.summary: Find the most recent turn which has some WorldStateChanges. Undo this turn and return an ArrayList which will tell the graphics how the turn should be undone.

member.name: M:GridWorld.WorldState.UndoLastReplayTurnWithWorldStateChanges
member.summary: Find the most previous replay turn which has some WorldStateChanges. Undo this turn and return an ArrayList which will tell the graphics how the turn should be undone. If there are no world state changes in any previous turn then return an empty ArrayList and set TurnNumber == 1.
